1.brief: David, the youngest son of Jesse
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

2.brief: to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to test; by implication, to attempt
to fuse (metal), i.e. refine (literally or figuratively)
a kidney (as an essential organ); figuratively, the mind (as the interior self)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

4.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, an adult (as of full length); by implication, a man (only in the plural)
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to veil from sight, i.e. conceal (literally or figuratively)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

5.brief: properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

6.brief: to lave (the whole or a part of a thing)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

7.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, an extension of the hand, i.e. (by implication) avowal, or (usually) adoration; specifically, a choir of worshippers
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, perhaps to separate, i.e. distinguish (literally or figuratively); by implication, to be (causatively, make) great, difficult, wonderful

8.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
an abode, of God (the Tabernacle or the Temple), men (their home) or animals (their lair); hence, a retreat (asylum)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

9.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to gather for any purpose; hence, to receive, take away, i.e. remove (destroy, leave behind, put up, restore, etc.)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a criminal, or one accounted guilty
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

10.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a plan, especially a bad one
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)

11.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

12.brief: a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

a level, i.e. a plain (often used (with the article prefix) as a proper name of certain districts); figuratively, concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) justice (sometimes adverbially, justly)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
